snippet: New York jazz clubs took a hit during Hurricane Sandy last week, but for many it was only a minor disruption.
abstract: Nate Chinen Critic's Notebook welcomes return of performers to New York City's jazz clubs, many of which suffered losses of power and revenue during blackouts caused by Hurricane Sandy; expresses relief that disruptions for city's jazz scene seem minor and temporary.
lead_paragraph: New York jazz clubs took a hit during Hurricane Sandy last week, but for many it was only a minor disruption.

headline.seo: The Blue Note and Other Jazz Spots Weather Hurricane Sandy
headline.main: Back in the Groove After the Storm
headline.print_headline: Back in the Groove After the Storm
